block.p: Tara Pam Cook, a daughter of Arleen and Edwin Cook of Easton, Conn., is to be married today to Owen Stuart Littman, a son of Marilyn and Joel Littman of East Brunswick, N.J. Rabbi Leon Waldman is to officiate at Congregation Beth El in Fairfield, Conn.

The bride, 25, is studying at the Benjamin N. Cardozo School of Law of Yeshiva University in Manhattan. She graduated from Brandeis. Her father is a periodontist in Fairfield. Her mother is a volunteer meal coordinator at Operation Hope, a homeless shelter in Fairfield.

Tara Pam Cook, a daughter of Arleen and Edwin Cook of Easton, Conn., is to be married today to Owen Stuart Littman, a son of Marilyn and Joel Littman of East Brunswick, N.J. Rabbi Leon Waldman is to officiate at Congregation Beth El in Fairfield, Conn.

The bride, 25, is studying at the Benjamin N. Cardozo School of Law of Yeshiva University in Manhattan. She graduated from Brandeis. Her father is a periodontist in Fairfield. Her mother is a volunteer meal coordinator at Operation Hope, a homeless shelter in Fairfield.

The bridegroom, 27, is an associate in the Manhattan office of Morgan, Lewis & Bockius, a law firm. He graduated cum laude from Duke and received a law degree from New York University. His mother is a speech pathologist at Public School 42 in Eltingville, Staten Island. His father is the chairman of the science department and an assistant principal at Tottenville High School in Huguenot, Staten Island.
